wikipedia_page.main: Geoff Dyson (16 March 1923 - April 1989) was an English professional footballer who played as an inside left.

link_mentions.page: List of Bradford City A.F.C. players (1–49 league appearances)

response: The Mussabini Medal celebrated "the contribution of coaches of UK performers who have achieved outstanding success on the world stage." Along with the Mussabini Medal, there also existed The Dyson Award, for "individuals who have made a sustained and significant contribution to the development and management of coaching and individual coaches in the UK". This award was named after Geoff Dyson, the first chief national athletics coach, who died in 1981.
